result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Daris T. Strait was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution.  Request for restitution hearing to be done within 30 days if amounts are disputed.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Court enters an order for the 10% restitution surcharge.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Comply with all mental health treatment.

Take all prescribed medications. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so.

records.addlTxt: from Defendant
from defendant dated 4/25/15
Denying Request for Sentence Modification
from Defendant dated 1/30/15
L. Hilgers
M. Meyer

Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court and both counsel have received the PSI as well as letters from victims.
Court questions Atty Bender. 
State files restitution requests. 
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
25 years prison with 15 years initial confinement followed by 10 years extended supervision: 
Not eligible for the Earned Release or Challenge Incarceration programs. 
207 days jail credit. 
Copy of explanation of determinate sentence is provided to the defendant
CONDITIONS:
Comply with all mental health treatment.
Take all prescribed medications.
No contact with the victims. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so. 
Pay restitution - Court adopts the amounts submitted by the State.  Request for restitution hearing to be done within 30 days if amounts are disputed. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Atty Knaapen asks for the 10% restitution surcharge. Believes it is mandatory. 
BY THE COURT:  Court enters that order.
from Defendant

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in court with attorney Richard E Bender. Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in custody. Intern Krause w/ ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  ct 1:   30 yr Prison Sentence: 15 yr Incarceration and 15 yrs Extended Supervision. Free to argue.  PSI Requested.  Counts 2 & 3 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Ct 1 No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Counts 2 & 3 are Dismissed Read In.

BTC: Court orders PSI, to be completed by 9-05-14 with copies forward to counsel.

Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in court with attorney Richard E Bender. Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in CUSTODY. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:50 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court makes statements to the Court that the Defendant is able to proceed.
Defendant claims to be competent.
State has no proof to the contrary and Defendant is found competent.
Attorneys stipulate to the report filed by Dr Hurlbut.

PRELIMINARY HEARING:
Defendant will be waiving his right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Court informs the Defendant of the elements and his right to the Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant will be waiving his right to the Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

BY THE COURT:
Defendant has been found competent by the Court.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.
for Competency Examination by DHS
Competency hearing on May 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in court with attorney Richard E Bender. Defendant Roy Daris T. Strait in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Knaapen indicates they are not able to proceed with the Preliminary Hearing.  Motion has been filed re: Defendant's competency. 
Atty Bender makes statements to the Court.  In his clients best interest to proceed to competency.  Has not prepared the Order. 
BY THE COURT:  Atty Bender to prepare the order for the Court's signature. 

Court will not do anything further in this case.  Court enters the order that a competency evaluation be ordered.  Competency hearing will need to be scheduled.  Once the prepared order is in place, a hearing date will need to be set.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.
